scenarioDescription:
The HD 147379 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 147379 is a star with 0.6 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.57 times its radius. It is located 35.11 light years away from the solar system.

HD 147379 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 147379 system


HD 147379 b

HD 147379 b was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2018-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.32 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 147379 b is 28.566 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 147379 b is 5.820 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 147379 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 147379, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory.
name: HD 147379 - System With 1 Exoplanet
